segments.en: Linked Discourses 7
2. Lay Followers
15. Stuck-Up
At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena mānatthaddho nāma brāhmaṇo sāvatthiyaṃ paṭivasati.
segments.en: Now at that time a brahmin named Stuck-Up was residing in Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: So neva mātaraṃ abhivādeti, na pitaraṃ abhivādeti, na ācariyaṃ abhivādeti, na jeṭṭhabhātaraṃ abhivādeti.
segments.en: He didn’t bow to his mother or father, his teacher, or his oldest brother.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā mahatiyā parisāya parivuto dhammaṃ deseti.
segments.en: Now, at that time the Buddha was teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly.
Then Stuck-Up thought,

segments.pli: “ayaṃ kho samaṇo gotamo mahatiyā parisāya parivuto dhammaṃ deseti.
segments.en: “The ascetic Gotama is teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly.
Why don’t I approach him?

segments.pli: Sace maṃ samaṇo gotamo ālapissati, ahampi taṃ ālapissāmi.
segments.en: If he speaks to me, I’ll speak to him.

segments.pli: No ce maṃ samaṇo gotamo ālapissati, ahampi nālapissāmī”ti.
segments.en: But if he doesn’t speak, neither will I.”

segments.pli: Atha kho mānatthaddho brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā tuṇhībhūto ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
segments.en: Then the brahmin Stuck-Up went up to the Buddha, and stood silently to one side.
But the Buddha didn’t speak to him.
Then Stuck-Up thought,

segments.pli: “nāyaṃ samaṇo gotamo kiñci jānātī”ti tatova puna nivattitukāmo ahosi.
segments.en: “This ascetic Gotama knows nothing!” And he wanted to go back from there right away.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā mānatthaddhassa brāhmaṇassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya mānatthaddhaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Then the Buddha, knowing what Stuck-Up was thinking, addressed him in verse:
“It’s not good to foster conceit
if you want what’s good for you, brahmin.
You should foster the goal
which brought you here.”
Then Stuck-Up thought,

segments.pli: “cittaṃ me samaṇo gotamo jānātī”ti tattheva bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavato pādāni mukhena ca paricumbati pāṇīhi ca parisambāhati, nāmañca sāveti:
segments.en: “The ascetic Gotama knows my mind!” He bowed with his head to the Buddha’s feet, caressing them and covering them with kisses, and pronounced his name:
“Master Gotama, I am Stuck-Up! I am Stuck-Up!”

segments.pli: Atha kho sā parisā abbhutavittajātā ahosi:
segments.en: Then that assembly was stunned:
“It’s incredible, it’s amazing!

segments.pli: Ayañhi mānatthaddho brāhmaṇo neva mātaraṃ abhivādeti, na pitaraṃ abhivādeti, na ācariyaṃ abhivādeti, na jeṭṭhabhātaraṃ abhivādeti;
segments.en: This brahmin Stuck-Up doesn’t bow to his mother or father, his teacher, or his oldest brother.

segments.pli: atha ca pana samaṇe gotame evarūpaṃ paramanipaccakāraṃ karotī”ti.
segments.en: Yet he shows such utmost devotion to the ascetic Gotama!”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā mānatthaddhaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the Buddha said to the brahmin Stuck-Up,
“Enough, brahmin. Get up, and take your own seat.
For your mind has confidence in me.”

segments.pli: Atha kho mānatthaddho brāhmaṇo sake āsane nisīditvā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Then Stuck-Up took his seat and said to the Buddha:
“Regarding whom should you not be conceited?
Who should you respect?
Who should you esteem?
Who is it good to venerate properly?”
“Your mother and father,
and also your oldest brother,
with teacher as fourth.
Regarding these you should not be conceited.
They are who you should respect.
They are who you should esteem.
And they’re who it’s good to venerate properly.
And when you’ve humbled conceit, and aren’t stuck-up,
show supreme reverence for
the perfected ones, cooled,
their task complete, free of defilements.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, mānatthaddho brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he had spoken, the brahmin Stuck-Up said to the Buddha,
“Excellent, Master Gotama …

segments.pli: upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
segments.en: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

suttaplex.blurb: A stuck-up brahmin listening to the Buddha teach is awestruck when the Buddha appears to read his mind. To the surprise of the crowd, he bows and kisses the Buddha’s feet. The Buddha tells him to take his seat, and they exchange verses on the topic of conceit.
